title:
Cross Sectional Regression with Cluster Dependence: Inference based on
  Averaging
authors: Subhodeep Dey, Gopal K. Basak and Samarjit Das
abstract:
We re-investigate the asymptotic properties of the traditional OLS (pooled)
estimator, $\hat{\beta} _P$, with cluster dependence. The present study
considers various scenarios under various restrictions on the cluster sizes and
number of clusters. It is shown that $\hat{\beta}_P$ could be inconsistent in
many realistic situations. We propose a simple estimator, $\hat{\beta}_A$ based
on data averaging. The asymptotic properties of $\hat{\beta}_A$ is studied. It
is shown that $\hat{\beta}_A$ is consistent even when $\hat{\beta}_P$ is
inconsistent. It is further shown that the proposed estimator $\hat{\beta}_A$
could be more efficient as compared to $\hat{\beta}_P$ in many practical
scenarios. As a consequence of averaging, we show that $\hat{\beta}_A$ retains
consistency, asymptotic normality under classical measurement error problem
circumventing the use of IV. A detailed simulation study shows the efficacy of
$\hat{\beta}_A$. It is also seen that $\hat{\beta}_A$ yields better goodness of
fit.
